revised_title: Swirling Fluid Flow in a Vertical Pipe and Bend: Experiments and Observations
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the swirling flow of water in a vertical pipe and a bend, observing the behavior of the fluid and the entrainment of air. They found that at moderate swirls, a large volume of air was entrained at the bend, which can reduce the capacity of the pipe and cause undesirable consequences. The author also studied the collapse of air vortices and the formation of helical striations in the fluid, providing an approximate theory to explain these effects.
